website_summaries.verdict: A chair mat that costs a little more, but seems to perform better than many others on the market.
pros: Does not have big problems with dimples under the feet of your chair
Rigid construction and yet thin and light
cons: Costs more than a lot of other mats, but worth it for the durability
The nubs are a little short for deep plush carpet

customer_reviews.title: Face injury when unpacking. See picture.
customer_reviews.text: This mat is extremely dangerous to unfurl and should be shipped flat. I am 71 and my husband is 75. I was helping my husband unwrap it when it snapped open, hit me in the face and sent my glasses flying off my face. Fortunately, my eye was not hit directly and my glasses did not break. After this happened, we found the “Warning” sheet on the floor. Obviously it, too, had flown out from somewhere in the wrapping. It should have been visible on the box AND on the OUTSIDE of the cellophane wrapping. The warning does not give specific direction for avoiding injury. The mat itself appears to be of high quality, but the shipping method is dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: J. Caverly

customer_reviews.title: Cracked and broke after 18 months.
customer_reviews.text: Cracked and broke after a year and half despite being "Guaranteed not to crack, curl" and having a lifetime warranty. "A shipping and handling fee of $30.00 will be charged for all warranty replacements" and you have to ship it to them at your cost. You have to pay about half the cost of the mat in order to use the warranty. The mat was fine for 18 months, but it was far too expensive to be something you'd want to buy, or exercise the "warranty" on every 18 months. I would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: A. Waters

customer_reviews.title: This mat started to crack after only about six months of use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mat in January of 2019 and after only about six months of use, it began to crack. Now there are more cracks in it that you can count. It is sturdy and you definitely need to be careful when you are releasing the binding that keeps it rolled up during transit as the edges are sharp and it springs into shape immediately. I had high hopes for this product in the beginning and it worked flawlessly for a brief period of time but it does not last. I would not recommend this product to anyone for use on carpet that is even the least bit spongy.
customer_reviews.author: Ron R.

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy--I returned the item
customer_reviews.text: This item was not sturdy and my office chair would dig grooves into it. Its did not allow easy movement of wheels of chair. I had to return this mat, pay twice as much for one from Just Chair Mats. Even though I buy most everything on Amazon I could not find a suitable product on Amazon this time.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Savela

customer_reviews.title: Nice mat.
customer_reviews.text: I had ordered a $40 dollar mat from some other site and it was junk. The chair wheels sunk into the plastic and I couldn’t move. I bought this one and it works perfect. The mat is thick and hard enough to prevent the wheels from sinking and it seems good quality. I would buy again. My floor is carpeted with a plush with short fibers.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Webster

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: This mat was advertised as for "high" pile carpet but is absolutely worthless, as it "walks" all over the room with minimal chair movement. No label on mat so I have no idea if I was sent the one I ordered or some other model. It was returned as absolutely worthless for carpeted floors.
customer_reviews.author: Gary D Wiens

customer_reviews.title: 4-1/2 years old and going strong!
customer_reviews.text: 4-1/2 years old and going strong! I purchased it in Nov 2014, and it still looks like I just got it. There's no cracking (as I've seen others complaining about). There's no discoloration. It never had that chemical odor. I've been really happy with this chair mat. The only possible issue is that I sometimes need to reposition it because it creeps about 1/2" maybe every month or two. But, I'm an IT consultant and I'm often at my desk 10-18 hours a day, so this mat gets a lot of use. I'd say that the amount of creep is not really an issue at all. It's been well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Underwood

customer_reviews.title: VERY Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting much when I ordered this mat, but much nicer in quality than I was hoping for. I've had several over the years and none lasted very long. Straight from the box, it was sturdier and thicker than all the other mats I have purchased. It's been a few months now in use 40 hrs per week on a medium length pile and no dents. It came rolled up despite the description and you have to be careful opening it up because it snaps open once released from the tape holding it together.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice mat. Arrived in excellent condition.
customer_reviews.text: Received the chair mat today. Mat arrived in perfect condition but the shipping box was a bit damaged. Followed the instruction for unrolling the mat and worked out great! There is a little snap from the mat when you cut the band. My mat did not come with a black band as in the video but had clear plastic wrapped around it very well and sturdy. The mat seem to stay put much better then my old chair mat that I had for almost 10 years. We will see in time how well this mat does.
customer_reviews.author: HG

customer_reviews.title: Great Product - Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Far superior to anything you can buy in the store from an office supply store like Staples. My office has a medium-pile carpet with a good pad underneath. In the past, I had to stack two of the "best" PVC mats on top of one another and they still developed ruts and eventually cracked. I only weigh 165 pounds, so I was pretty surprised and frustrated by the lack of performance from the in-store mats. This unit works perfectly - the chair rolls smoothly and there are absolutely no ruts, no matter how long the chair stays in the same position. This is a great product and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Neil_O

customer_reviews.title: It Crawls
customer_reviews.text: This mat seems sturdy, the chair doesn't sink into it, and the chair glides across easily (sometimes more than I want), but it crawls on the carpet even though it states for plush pile carpet. That gets frustrating. I bought it to replace one that I had purchased years ago from Costco, (sadly they no longer carried it). The old one was perfect. This one seemed like the best option since I could no longer get the same one I had.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: I would definitely recommend this for anyone who has carpeting that they wish ...
customer_reviews.text: We have converted one of our bedrooms, and we call it "The Computer Room". This room has both of our computers that are back to back. Our carpet is a medium pile, and in the past, the chair mats have had the tendency to sag under the chairs (mine a lot more than hers). I ordered a new mat for her based on the type of mat and was pleasantly surprised at how hard the material was. The mat came rolled up, so be sure to read the instructions on how to cut the band. I would definitely recommend this for anyone who has carpeting that they wish to protect.
customer_reviews.author: Karaokekid

customer_reviews.title: Cleartex Ultimat Chair Mat
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. This mat is advertised to be on plush carpets which mine is and I have only had it for a week, If it starts to crack I will return it. That's why I purchased an expensive mat. Will update in 6 months. Just want to add: read instructions carefully b/4 unwrapping the mat. IT WILL SPRING OPEN QUICKLY! Had my husband been closer to our big screen TV when he opened ours he would have trashed it. 5/8/2020 PRODUCT UPDATE: VERY DISAPPOINTED - MAT STARTED CRACKING A FEW MONTHS BACK AND NOW BIG HOLES IN IT WHERE CHAIR WHEEL GETS STUCK.
customer_reviews.author: Cricket

customer_reviews.title: Very rigid!  Seems very durable.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had several mats before and they seem to last only a few years before they develop cracks. All of them had some flex on soft carpets. This mat seems much more rigid and does not flex when rolling the chair over it. I suspect it will be more durable than other mats so it’s probably worth he extra money if it lasts. I would recommend it for others if you have plush carpeting. One word of caution. It arrives in a large box slightly rolled up. When you cut the wrapping, it’s springs it into the flat shape like a big mousetrap so stand back!. -)
customer_reviews.author: OneBigKid

customer_reviews.title: Great Floor protector
customer_reviews.text: I've had several of these over the years. They seem to last along time but will eventually will break down. I have had my current one about 6 months or so and no issues. It sits on medium carpet and the office chair slides smoothly over the pad. No dents. Great buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Retired

customer_reviews.title: Great mat, but ...
customer_reviews.text: Great mat! One very small problem seems to be the small, short tits on the bottom side meant to keep the mat form sliding around. This mat does slowly move around, in my case about one inch a week. It handles the chair rollers without visible deflection. A little longer tits and this mat would surely be a stellar keeper!
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Shultz

customer_reviews.title: The ULTIMATE Chair Mat - Floortex 1113427LR Ultimat Polycarbonate Chair Mat for Carpets Over 1/2" Thick, 48"x53", Rectangular wi
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this particular one because of the reviews and the claims that it does not get indented by your chair. Pros: - Ships to you folded, not rolled up. Instantly sat flat on the floor. - Holds up easily to me and my chair (220 + 40lbs). Never creates dents if I leave the chair in one place - No Smell - Stays put in one place. I have medium frieze carpet and it never moves. Cons: -None so far. ( I have owned it for 6 months) I am glad I didn't try and "save" some money and buy a lesser mat...
customer_reviews.author: PlanoTech

customer_reviews.title: A bit pricey but great quality
customer_reviews.text: We’ve only had the mat for a little over a month, but we’re impressed with the quality, size & crystal clarity. It cost a bit more than we planned but if it lasts, its worth it. Our last mat started to shatter only after a year of use. (Our mat is used over thick carpeting over 1/2 inch.)
customer_reviews.author: G. Saffren

customer_reviews.title: This mat is awesome
customer_reviews.text: I was really unsettled about spending a lot of money on a chair mat. I bought one of these and love it! You can't go wrong! it is awesome. No wheel mark indentations at all. I am a large person and I have had no problems with the mat.
customer_reviews.author: Wise Shopper

customer_reviews.title: BEST chair mat!
customer_reviews.text: BEST chair mat! Strong and smooth. I purchased a different one a few weeks before this one and it smelt like plastic real bad every time i opened my office door. The other one also was holding moisture of some sort under it probably because it was cheap Japanese plastic that still cost me $50 here on Amazon. I threw them out!!!! And ordered this one even though it was $90 ! But I have NO issues with moisture and it is very smooth and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Anita

customer_reviews.title: Thick, durable material, but it slides around
customer_reviews.text: This chair mat is great--very high quality material, thick and durable. But although it is advertised for use with 1/2" pile carpet, the little spiky nubs on the bottom side are simply not long enough to hold the mat in place on thick-pile carpet. Aside from that it works well, but it's annoying enough to warrant only a three-star rating, IMHO.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Heacock

customer_reviews.title: doesn't stay in place
customer_reviews.text: I don't normally write negative reviews, but this has been frustrating. I ordered two of the mats that are for carpet less than 1/2" thick and they didn't stay in place. Then, I ordered one that is designated for carpets greater than 1/2" thick. I received the exact same one as before.......no difference. And, of course, doesn't stay in place. I am now past the window to return one of them and am out a lot of money for a chair mat. Never had any troubles with brands I have purchased in the past. Thought I was buying very good quality.......guess not!
customer_reviews.author: Erin C.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mat, but not even close for plush carpets.
customer_reviews.text: So this mat was a bit expensive, but the polycarobonite material is very stiff so it does not dent under the weight of a chair with casters. The only down side to this is the nibs on the bottom as very short so the mat still will depress into the carpet in the area of the casters since the mat essentially lays on top of the carpet. We have very short loop carpet on 7/16 padding and these nibs are probably 1-2 mm if that. Would be nice if they really went into the carpet too help drive more of the load below the carpet into the pad of floor.
customer_reviews.author: KeithL

customer_reviews.title: Won't stay in place!
customer_reviews.text: It's sturdy, it's thick, it's extremely durable. What it *won't* do, however, is stay in one place. I have regular pile carpet you find in just about any residence in the US, and this mat won't stay still it slides around as I move about on it and I have to readjust it every morning. If this were a $30 product, I'd be less disappointed, but for $100, I expected something as basic as this not to be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Parris

customer_reviews.title: Shifting problem.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed that this chair mat is supposed to be for deep pile carpets which I believed meant it would bite into the carpet and not prevent shifting. It does not. It shifts and does not bold. No better than others that are NOT for deep pile carpets. Good thing is that it is a firm hard surface. But, it's cleats are not deep enough to hold in deep pile carpet.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Richards

customer_reviews.title: DANGER-DANGER***BEWARE OF THE PACKAGING!!!
customer_reviews.text: There is a warning on the outside of the box and on the shrink wrap about how to remove the shrink wrap. READ IT. I did not see them and this heavy mat slapped me in the face, knocked my glasses off and gave me a bruise. BOTTOM LINE: The manufacturer SHOULD NOT roll this thing up to ship it. It may be a smaller package but it could do real harm. Providing a warning and reading the warning does not mean it won't pop open when the pressure is released and cause damage. It should never be put under that amount of pressure since it eventually does have to be released!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Harris

customer_reviews.title: Works well and I'd buy another
customer_reviews.text: Nice mat is stiff and dense. Looks like it will resist cavitating quite well, even though it's on a medium thick rug with pad. Seems to stay put. By the way, this thing is near borderline for being rolled up for shipping. Mine was hand rolled and tight, use caution opening it.
customer_reviews.author: Knotmename

customer_reviews.title: Solid mat, but pay attention to the warnings about cutting the restraint strap!
customer_reviews.text: Take care! They are NOT kidding about the mat popping open when you cut the restraint strap! (I watched the video, and I still didn't expect it to explode open with such force!) This seems like a very firm, solid mat. I have it on a thick carpet (almost 1-inch pile), and my chair rolls like it's on wood. I'll be eager to see how this mat holds up, but it seems good so far.
customer_reviews.author: Kal

customer_reviews.title: Finally!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect. I have been looking for one but was afraid to buy it online for fear it would come all warped and never lay flat. This came in a large box rolled but with a strap and a warning to stand back when cutting the strap. When cut the mat does explode back to a flat condition with no memory of being rolled up. It is sturdy and works great on my carpet that is 1.25" thick including the pad. I have it pinched under the corner of my desk as the lip is wider than the opening and even the desk doesn't bend it. Well worth the extra price above some of the less expensive ones.
customer_reviews.author: ts.magrath

customer_reviews.title: Polycarbonate rules!
customer_reviews.text: Thick, strong, surprisingly light polycarbonate that does not dimple or dent even under very heavy loads. And because it does not dimple or dent, it is unlikely to stress-fracture and then break up like polyvinyl mats eventually do. If it wasn't for the fact that it came rolled up, I would believe it is a solid sheet. I have no idea how long it will actually last — the whole thing might suddenly crack someday — but for the time being, it is the best mat I've ever had. It is absolutely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H.

customer_reviews.title: Great material, mediocre grip
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be very durable, but only time will truly tell. The only issue I have is that it has very little grip on the carpet, causing it to slide a little when you move your chair around throughout the day. This may not be a big problem for most, but for me it has caused the lip of the mat to push up against the right support of my wood desk. I remedied it by reversing the mat, with the lip in the back. If this mat had a better grip on carpet, it would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: After over a year of constant use, this chair mat shows no signs of even beginning to fail. Lesser products usual start to fail at this point. So far, I impressed and highly recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: David G

customer_reviews.title: I thought I would get more use out of this mat but am very disappointed it failed after so little use
customer_reviews.text: I have had this mat for 15 months on deep pile carpet. I sit on a newer five wheeled office chair about 2 hours a day and I weigh about 230 pounds. This mat started getting cracks at the one year point and now at 15 months has many cracks and I am looking for a replacement. I thought I would get more use out of this mat but am very disappointed it failed after so little use. I cannot recommend it for deep pile carpet.
customer_reviews.author: AFretiree

customer_reviews.title: Came with 3 large creases
customer_reviews.text: Cannot attest to longevity as I just received this a few days ago. The 48x53 size with lip is great for my desk. Seems sturdy. I got the high pile carpet version, but it does slide a bit, needing adjustment. Unfortunately, my mat came with 3 large bends in the polycarbonate. They are along the edge and don't necessarily affect functionality, but they are an eyesore.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: floortex the only way to go.
customer_reviews.text: this is so much better than those plastic mats, I'm 310 lbs and this just rolls over like being on a hard floor, I had this about 2 weeks and I spend many hours in this chair a day, no dents from wheels and no cracks. I is best if the chair has wheels vs castor wheel, I will update this in a couple months.
customer_reviews.author: R. Wentland

customer_reviews.title: Very durable!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had bought this one first instead of the one that cracked and I wound up throwing away! If you’re looking for a good sturdy mat that is durable and won’t crack then this is the one you need.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product
customer_reviews.text: Had to drill holes in carpet and floor so the edges would stay down to be able to roll over with chair not to get caught on the edges/
customer_reviews.author: F.Miller

customer_reviews.title: creeps around!
customer_reviews.text: strong, and tapered edges, good. But for right now it creeps around on tall carpet. I expected this and still worth the price. Time will tell if it cracks or takes impressions from wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H.

customer_reviews.title: It does the trick
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews on this before buying. I have no issues with the way it came (rolled up). I was careful in opening it as the packaging warned. it laid flat immediately. It seems very durable...time will tell if it cracks, but it seems very strong. I use it on standard pile plush carpeting. It's a bit pricey, but I've had bad success with cheaper ones. I guess you get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Moyer

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Strong, durable. Does shift on carpet from time to time.
customer_reviews.author: Richard R. Steverson

customer_reviews.title: How can this mat be for a rug deeper than ...
customer_reviews.text: How can this mat be for a rug deeper than 1/2 inch, when the points that grip the rug are only between 1/8 and 1/4 inch long. This mat slides out of place every day. If I was 50/60 years younger I would return it.
customer_reviews.author: Iboleen

customer_reviews.title: Very good mat for my office
customer_reviews.text: I have a plush carpet. The mat I had before this just wasn't strong enough. The carpet allowed it to flex and it eventually broke apart. This mat is much stronger and I feel almost no flex in it. It doesn't really dimple from the wheels on the chair. I only just got it today but I can tell its a far superior mat. It's perfect for thick carpeting. My office chair also rolls very easily on and off the mat to the carpet. It doesn't catch on the edge every time I go off the mat like my other one did. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Ford Davies

customer_reviews.title: Too light to hold up.  I think it will crack soon.
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace an old one. Very unhappy with the new one as it is much lighter and 50 mm thinner. Realized when I picked the old one up that new mat was lighter, too light to work with carpet. Possibly packaged wrong?
customer_reviews.author: Bill McGill

customer_reviews.title: Finally a mat that works
customer_reviews.text: This is the 4th floor mat we have tried and the only one that works. My husband bought a heavy leather office chair with wheels that do not slide well. He has had no problems with moving the chair, it slides as though it is on a hardwood floor.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy L. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Poly Chair Mat
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this chair mat so far. My pedestal chair glides over the mat.
customer_reviews.author: Linda & Don

customer_reviews.title: That doesn't sound like a great deal to me
customer_reviews.text: A year after purchase, and there's a crack in it. Contacted company, and they want $22 for them to ship me a replacement. Luckily I don't have to ship back the broken one, but still really a bummer that I have to pay so much for shipping a replacement. That doesn't sound like a great deal to me. Next time I'll just buy a cheapie chair mat and replace it yearly like I used to. Spending more on a chair mat doesn't seem to net you a whole lot in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: N. Head

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: Paid higher price to hopefully get a mat that would stay put on my low pile carpet. I have even put my desk on it to keep it in place, NO LUCK. This one does not stay any better than the cheaper one, only thicker.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine H.

customer_reviews.title: Cleartex Ultimat Chair
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product. Purchased for husband initially he liked it so much, I decided to purchase one for my office as well. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: quilterb

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the extra money
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several chair mats in the past, and this one is the one I've been looking for. Have moderately thick carpet, and I can roll with my chair on this mat with ease. Would HIGHLY recommend !
customer_reviews.author: TommyTheK

customer_reviews.title: CHAIR MAT SIDES LIFT UP
customer_reviews.text: THE SIDE OF THE CHAIR MAT HAS LIFTED UP SINCE WE RECEIVED IT IN AUGUST AND IT IS VERY EASY TO TRIP OVER AS IT IS CLEAR. THE MAT DOES NOT CRACK, BUT THE SIDE LIFTING UP IS A SAFETY ISSUE. I AM CONSIDERING RETURNING IT!
customer_reviews.author: amdel

customer_reviews.title: Great mat for the first 2.5 testing warranty now.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this mat a few years ago because I'm a big guy so I wanted something sturdy. We also have a plush pile carpet and this was one of the few Chair mats that said it would handle a plush pile carpet. Mat worked great for 2 1/2 years but has now cracked. Contacting the manufacturing now to see how they handle warranties. Website says a 40 year warranty hoping they honor it. Will update once I found out.
customer_reviews.author: Jonelle E Strazdas

customer_reviews.title: Roll On!
customer_reviews.text: We just built a new home and we put carpeting in our huge master bedroom where I also set up my office. The carpeting is very dense and thick and I chose this mat after reading the reviews and it's working out very well. Nothing more frustrating than trying to roll your office chair on thick carpeting. I couldn't wait for this to come and it was delivered within a couple of days. Great quality. I'm sure you would not be disappointed if you ordered this.
customer_reviews.author: E. M. King

customer_reviews.title: So FarSo Good ---
customer_reviews.text: Have been using for a couple of months ---- So far, it's working very well !!!
customer_reviews.author: Roy L. Short

customer_reviews.title: It was great at first
customer_reviews.text: It was great at first, but now I have a 9 inch by 3 inch hole that has developed in the mat and it seems to be getting continually worse over time. For the money and the guarantee - this product should not have worn out in under 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Crosby

customer_reviews.title: great chair mat
customer_reviews.text: great chair mat. conducted a lot of research before purchasing this item. this is way more durable than the chair mat it replaced. well worth the money. update - have now had for 8 months -- good as new. ordering another one for another desk. absolutely outstanding !!!!!
customer_reviews.author: mpbud

customer_reviews.title: Don't make the mistake I made!
customer_reviews.text: The Mat hasn't held up as advertised. Backside Spikes / cleats aren't adequate (long enough) for deep pile carpets. The Mat has numerous cracks from normal home office chair usage resultant from mat NOT supporting deep pile carpet! Mat was constantly creeping!
customer_reviews.author: Glenn R. Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: but good quality mat
customer_reviews.text: A little pricey, but good quality mat. Using it on average thickness carpet maybe 1/2". My chair roles on it as expected and the mat doesn't move around or indent. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: T. Port

customer_reviews.title: be careful of the carpet grippers on the bottom  of chairmat
customer_reviews.text: good product. It can hold the weight as noted. that is the reason I purchased it. there was no wheel dimples in the mat. the box it was shipped had very good instructions about cutting the banding to flatten the rolled up chair mat. it did flatten almost immediately, approx. 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: John A Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the box and saw the mat was so thin it could be rolled up I was disappointed. (They aren't kidding about being careful when cutting the strap that holds the folded mat.) However, it is much stronger and my chair glides smoother than on my old thicker mat and it is solid on my carpeted floor. I would have preferred if the longer dimension had been to extend the side with the "tongue" but it's okay.
customer_reviews.author: Amaz-Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Best chair mat I have used so far.
customer_reviews.text: I am currently using this on a 1/2" thick carpet, it has held up well and does not flex to the point where my rolling office chair sinks in from sitting for hours in the chair. Two previous chair mats I had used, would flex and then make it so the chair's rollers would sink in and make it hard to roll the chair while seated.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy L.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, great customer service
customer_reviews.text: This mat is incredible. I have had it for over 2 years and from heavy use started to crack. I contacted Floortex directly about a warranty and without hastle over 2 years later they are shipping me a new one! Great product, great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: mooz

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected - Glad I got it
customer_reviews.text: This Floortex mat is clear and stiff. It is great for my low pile carpet. Some mats take a while to spring back into shape when coming out of the box. This one was flat the moment I cut the strap. (Just be careful when cutting the strap - this mat will spring open fast and hard!) Compared to the other cheaper mats, this one is a higher quality. I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gotta Be Polycarbonate!
customer_reviews.text: Now THIS is more like it! Don't waste any time and money on vinyl chair mats. They are ALL too flimsy. Only polycarbonate chair mats work and you will simply have to pay more for it.
customer_reviews.author: Arizona Dan

customer_reviews.title: Best Office Chair Mat Ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the best for all moderate deep-pile carpeting. My desk chair does not make cracks in it from the pressure of me sitting at my chair. If you have carpet in your office any more than an inch (padding plus the actual carpet) buy this chair mat. I love it!!! It is the best I have ever found.
customer_reviews.author: Minz

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: Everything about it is good, except it does not stay in the same spot on the carpet. It moves a few inches away from my desk about every week.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Finally I found a great office chair mat for carpet that stays put and ...
customer_reviews.text: Finally I found a great office chair mat for carpet that stays put and the chair glides over it like air! No cracking and my husband loves it!
customer_reviews.author: SUSAN

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Would not buy again. Mat clearly used with marks on it. Box was retaped and not sealed properly.
customer_reviews.author: goretex

customer_reviews.title: No Dimples!!
customer_reviews.text: I have this on a very plush carpet and I have no dimples where the wheels are. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Roz

customer_reviews.title: Easy rolling for a big guy!
customer_reviews.text: I am a big guy and this may is very easy rolling. It does not dimple as others have.
customer_reviews.author: George Wallace

customer_reviews.title: This mat is too thin. We bought two; ...
customer_reviews.text: This mat is too thin. We bought two; the chair rollers made dents making it frustrating to roll in and out of the dents and one mat cracked.
customer_reviews.author: D. Seabeck

customer_reviews.title: Not as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Much thinner than expected and the points underneath were for a medium depth carpet, but it slides all over the place. Constantly moving back into place.
customer_reviews.author: JKL

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Nice and hard. It came rolled up, but quickly flattened out and is able to withstand by big self (about 250 lbs) in an office chair. The cheaper PVC mats just wouldn't hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Engineer Mike

customer_reviews.title: Super chair mat!
customer_reviews.text: Be careful when opening the package!!!! This is a really nice, heavy duty chair mat that fits perfectly into the space that exists for it in my home office. You can roll right off the edge fairly easily, so you do need to be aware of that. Has almost no odor to it which is a huge plus.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy R. Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Only time will tell. The regular vinyl ones crack ...
customer_reviews.text: Only time will tell. The regular vinyl ones crack after about a year. We'll see how this one does with the test of time and use.
customer_reviews.author: DHA

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: much improved over a smaller mat that cracked badly after 6 months....still prone to some shifting on the carpet, but less than the smaller one
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Durable carpet protection
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product to protect carpeting from rolling office chairs. Appears to be very durable. I am very pleased with this mat.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Collins

customer_reviews.title: I was concerned that the floor mat would dent or ...
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned that the floor mat would dent or break, but it is solid and no issues. It does slide around the floor a bit, but that is ok with me.
customer_reviews.author: John Silver Spring

customer_reviews.title: Works wonderfully
customer_reviews.text: It is exactly what the video depicts. Wonderful. Highly recommend this item
customer_reviews.author: Clifford J.

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy. I have it on medium-pile carpet
customer_reviews.text: Had about 2 months now. Held up well so far. Very sturdy. I have it on medium-pile carpet, with a very think pad under it. The previous cheap mat I had scooted across the carpet of my home-office and had to be pulled back multiple times a day. This one still moves, but only need readjusting about once every 2 weeks. A MARKED improvement. Will update again if it holds up to wear and tear.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Built to last.
customer_reviews.text: ZERO wear or deflection after many months of use. I weigh 202# and my desk chair is another 15 or so. It still 'creeps' across the carpet a bit, but not enough to make me crazy.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Greene

customer_reviews.title: Stiff enough to allow chairs to roll easily even on the deepest pile carpets.
customer_reviews.text: Not as ridged as I expected, but chairs roll easy and it doesn't bend and flex as much as I expected. Definitely a good value.
customer_reviews.author: J. H. Goldman

customer_reviews.title: Still working great
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this mat for over ten months. It works perfectly on my fairly thick carpet -- no dimples or warping. And it has not developed any cracks at all!
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence J. King

customer_reviews.title: Cracks
customer_reviews.text: I have had this mag for 2 years and was very pleased for the first year. After the first year, it started developing cracks and grooves. It is now cracked all the way through. I have a nice leather office chair with casters.
customer_reviews.author: JRB

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stay put!
customer_reviews.text: The gripper back does not keep this from sliding around on the carpet. It's a pain to have to keep re-positioning it.
customer_reviews.author: Moqs

customer_reviews.title: Ordered with lip, received without lip
customer_reviews.text: Don't know how it got messed up, but its not worth returning. Kind of annoying. Quality is good though.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: I love it on my medium pile carpet in the den
customer_reviews.text: I love it on my medium pile carpet in the den. It holds and doesnt bend or get chair marks in it. I paid a little more for it than I wanted but needed the size. Paid for what I got. Great! Thanks
customer_reviews.author: L Nixon

customer_reviews.title: Cracked in 1 year
customer_reviews.text: Just like so many others have reported mine cracked at almost exactly 1 year. I was able to get a warranted replacement for mine so hopefully I can get another year out of this one.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Riggs

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Got this for my husband's office and it's working well.
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: This has been a great chair mat
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great chair mat. Im still using it after 2 years! It has held up well and I am a big guy.
customer_reviews.author: Todd L

customer_reviews.title: did not hold up.  full of cracks already.
customer_reviews.text: This product was to be for deep pile carpet yet it "floats" and does not stay in place. Also, it is starting to crack already. It was not worth the money we spent on it.
customer_reviews.author: DI

customer_reviews.title: Crack-resistant
customer_reviews.text: This is only material which does not easily crack/break under chair rollers.
customer_reviews.author: Walter H. Cantrell

customer_reviews.title: Chair mat for my home office
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Time will tell how long it lasts. The last mat (manufacturer unknown) lasted 1 year before it started to crack and needed replacement. I hope this one lasts longer.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Pietroluongo

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. I weigh 250 and the mat seems to ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I weigh 250 and the mat seems to be taking the chair wheels without problem - at least so far. Very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Louie Atlanta

customer_reviews.title: Love it Works WAY BETTER than those cheap imitation's sold ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it Works WAY BETTER than those cheap imitation's sold at Staples/Office Depot. Does not sink into carpet . . . my only wish is that the carpet grippers were longer as the mat does tend to slide.
customer_reviews.author: Scoop4612

customer_reviews.title: Cracked and disintegrated after 18 months
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. After 18 months began to crack and quickly became unusable. Steer clear!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Chair mat
customer_reviews.text: This is more expensive then the mats I had bought at the office stores but I was lucky if they lasted 6 months. Have now had this a little over a month and so far am very pleased with it. No signs of cracking or dents from the chair. Several people said be careful when you cut the strap and that is very true. It springs very quickly. Once the strap was off mat laid flat immediately.
customer_reviews.author: scoutmama

customer_reviews.title: It cracked after just a few months.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy it. It is not worth it for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Raul Perez

customer_reviews.title: good size.
customer_reviews.text: Does not stay put. Sliding a real problem, good size.
customer_reviews.author: Bob G.

customer_reviews.title: Works well on thick carpet
customer_reviews.text: We are using this on thick carpet and it works great. After 3-4 months, no deformations or any signs of wear yet. The chair rolls smoothly. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Dano

customer_reviews.title: It was good quality and continues to appear shiny although it has ...
customer_reviews.text: This was on sale when I bought it. It was good quality and continues to appear shiny although it has had a lot of wear.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Subject

product_meta.title: Floortex Polycarbonate Chair Mat with Lip 48" x 53" for Plush Pile Carpets
product_meta.description: Cleartex Ultimat chair mat is the ultimate in quality and durability. This clear rectangular mat for longer, plush pile carpet flooring is made from sturdy polycarbonate, which has double the strength of PVC – and the added benefits that it won’t scratch, crack, buckle, curl at the edges, or discolor and it has no odor. The Ultimat has ergonomic benefits for chair users and allows an easy glide movement which can reduce leg fatigue. Ultimat is environmentally safe, free from PVC and free from toxic chemicals, is 100% recyclable and is a good choice for people with allergies. Cleartex polycarbonate mats lie perfectly flat and can be used immediately.
feature_bullets: Rectangular chair mat with lip for use under desks - protects plush carpets from damage caused by moving chair casters; made from polycarbonate - an incredibly tough and firm material which will not crack, curl, discolor or smell
Chair wheels will not sink into a polycarbonate mat under correct use

The transparency of this mat allows your flooring to show through - it won't look intrusive in your home or office; lies perfectly flat right away and has an easy glide surface to help reduce leg fatigue
Safe for the environment; 100% recyclable; free from toxic chemicals and PVC; child and pet safe; Greenguard certified
Gripper back for stability on plush-pile, thicker carpets; rectangular with lip; 48" x 53" (lip: 25" x 10"); mat size may vary slightly due to manufacturing process

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars221 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
